newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines raises alert on Mayon volcano.
newsitem.headline: Philippines raises alert on Mayon volcano.

text.p: The Philippines has raised an alert on Mayon volcano in the central Philippines due to an increased level of activity in the area, government vulcanologists said on Saturday.
The Philippine Institute of Vulcanology and Seismology said in a bulletin that it had recorded persistent crater glow, increased daily earthquakes and higher sulfur dioxide output.

"We raised the alert level from zero to one due to a slight increase in the overall level of activity but there is no clear or imminent sign of eruption," Edgar Angal, Phivolcs vulcanologist told Reuters.
The agency warned the public to strictly observe the six-kilometre (3.75 mile) radius permanent danger zone.
The last recorded eruption of Mayon, known for its perfect cone, was in February 1993, vulcanologists said.
